description: The ripple effects of President Donald Trump’s new wave of sweeping tariffs announced this week will be felt the most by lower-income Americans, who are heavily reliant on products from countries hit the hardest by Trump’s tariffs.
title: Trump's new tariffs will hit lower-income households the hardest

description: In today’s edition, our Capitol Hill team explores how Republicans are joining with Democrats in efforts to check President Donald Trump’s tariffs.
title: Congress tries to restrain Trump on tariffs: From the Politics Desk

description: A New Jersey mother who drowned her two children last year for "religious reasons" was found not guilty by reason of insanity, a court ruled Tuesday.
title: New Jersey mom who drowned her 2 toddlers found not guilty by reason of insanity

description: Tennessee’s workplace safety agency has absolved a plastics plant of responsibility in the deaths of six workers who were swept away by floodwaters from Hurricane Helene.
title: Plastics factory found not responsible for deaths of workers during Hurricane Helene flooding

description: Lawyers for Sean Combs have asked a judge to prevent a clinical psychologist from testifying as an expert witness for the prosecution at his upcoming trial on charges of sex trafficking and racketeering conspiracy, arguing that her “testimony is advocacy masquerading as expertise” and “should be excluded in its entirety.”
title: Sean Combs' attorneys seek to block psychologist from testifying at May trial

description: A San Diego jury awarded a female former police officer $10 million in damages after she won a harassment and discrimination case against her former department.
title: Former California police officer awarded $10 million in harassment suit

description: Public health experts were stunned this week when Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and DOGE gutted key groups that had been successful in helping Americans quit smoking.
title: HHS gutted programs to help people quit smoking. The impact could be deadly.

description: The Pentagon's internal watchdog notified the defense secretary of a probe into whether he shared classified information last month in a Signal group chat that included a journalist.
title: Pentagon inspector general to investigate Pete Hegseth's role in Signal chat leak

description: The New England Patriots have agreed to trade quarterback Joe Milton III to the Dallas Cowboys.
title: Patriots trade quarterback Joe Milton to the Cowboys

description: The fallout from President Donald Trump's aggressive tariffs has spurred Congress into action, with a growing number of Republicans joining Democrats to express interest in using their power to restrain him.
title: Republicans weigh using the power of Congress to rein in Trump on tariffs

description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s Department of Health and Human Services cut $2 billion from a program that supports vaccines for vulnerable children.
title: How Kennedy is already weakening America's childhood vaccine system

description: The CEO of a California-based financial services company faces a federal assault charge for allegedly choking a man while on a Virgin Voyages cruise ship.
title: CEO accused of choking and threatening man on cruise ship over barefoot dancing incident

description: President Trump was asked about the market's response after his tariff announcement, saying he believed it was "going well" and that the country is "going to boom."
title: Trump believes the reaction to his tariffs is 'going very well'

description: The peeps, hoots and grunts of wild bonobos, a species of great ape living in the African rainforest, can convey complex thoughts in a way that mirrors some elements of human language, a new study suggests.
title: Hoots and grunts from bonobos show signs of complex communication, researchers say

description: NBC News' Julie Tsirkin reports on a meeting far-right activist Laura Loomer had with President Trump and other White House staff about her dissatisfaction about members of the national security team.
title: Far-right activist Laura Loomer met with Trump at the White House

description: USA Fencing said its decision to disqualify a female fencer after she refused to compete against a transgender opponent was in line with rules established by the sport’s governing body.
title: USA Fencing disqualifies female fencer for refusing to fight trans opponent

description: Scientists are finding microplastics everywhere from brain tissue to arteries and warning of the health risks posed by their buildup inside our bodies.
title: It doesn't take much for microplastics to leach into food, researchers warn

description: Skeletal remains found in an Illinois river have been identified as those of a young woman who went missing more than four decades ago, in a case that prompted detectives to launch their own podcast looking for answers, officials said Thursday.
title: Illinois police who started cold case podcast find submerged remains of woman last seen nearly 42 years ago

description: Eight key OPEC+ producers on Thuesday agreed to raise combined crude oil output by 411,000 barrels per day, speeding up the pace of their scheduled hikes and pushing down oil prices.
title: Eight OPEC+ producers accelerate crude oil output hikes, pushing oil prices 6% lower

description: A man who said he was "angry with pharmacies" is accused of fatally shooting a Walgreens employee after opening fire inside a California store Monday night.
title: California man 'angry with pharmacies' accused of shooting and killing Walgreens employee

description: DETROIT — President Donald Trump’s 25% tariffs on imported vehicles to the U.S. have taken effect, but the impacts of the new levies on investors and the global automotive industry will play out over the months, if not years, to come.
title: Trump's 25% auto tariffs are in effect. What investors need to know.

description: At his Singapore-based family office, Srihari Kumar has long favored U.S. investments.
title: Family offices are moving money out of the U.S. on tariff, economic fears

description: Olivia Munn, who is returning to acting after breast cancer, says she was actually more insecure about her body before surgery and values her body much more now.
title: Olivia Munn reflects on topless scene in new show after having double mastectomy

description: A line of storms stretching from Texas to the Northeast has been blamed for several deaths and left tens of thousands without electricity.
title: Multiple fatalities confirmed as powerful storms push across U.S.

description: The group helping the Venezuelan immigrant who's donating a kidney for his brother with end-stage renal disease said ICE's temporary release is a "victory" for compassion.
title: Organ donor for ailing brother to be temporarily released from immigration detention

description: Tufts University petitioned a federal judge to release student Rümeysa Öztürk, some of the strongest pushback by a school against the Trump administration's arrests of foreign students in recent weeks.
title: Tufts University pushes for release of student grabbed off the street by immigration officials

description: President Donald Trump fired at least one National Security Council official this week after far-right activist Laura Loomer met with the president and expressed dissatisfaction with some officials on his national security team, two people familiar with the matter told NBC News.
title: Trump fired at least one national security aide following pressure from far-right activist Laura Loomer

description: DETROIT — Stellantis is pausing production at two assembly plants in Canada and Mexico as the company attempts to navigate President Donald Trump’s new round of 25% automotive tariffs, the company confirmed Thursday.
title: Stellantis idles plants in Mexico and Canada due to tariffs

description: Stocks nosedived at the opening bell after President Donald Trump upended global markets by announcing tariffs on almost all imports coming into the United States. NBC News' Brian Cheung reports on how the markets are reacting to the tariffs.
title: Markets plunge as Trump tariffs spark fears of a trade war

description: In the 22 days since Maryland resident Kilmar Abrego Garcia was mistakenly deported to a notoriously violent prison in El Salvador, his young son has sought comfort in the scent of his missing father’s clothes.
title: Outrage grows over Maryland man’s mistaken deportation to El Salvador prison

description: President Donald Trump announced an across-the-board minimum 10% tariff on all trading partners, with some "reciprocal tariffs" imposed on dozens of countries he says are ripping the United States off the most. Many economists say the actions are certain to hit consumers' wallets. NBC’s Peter Alexander reports for TODAY.
title: Trump launches 10% minimum tariffs on every US trading partner

description: Dozens of progressive groups are sounding the alarm over what they’re calling an “unprecedented constitutional danger” presented by the Trump administration and Congress' attacks on the judiciary.
title: More than 80 progressive groups warn against Trump and Congress' attacks on the judiciary

description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams will run for reelection as an independent, opting out of the Democratic primary just one day after a federal judge dismissed corruption charges against him.
title: Eric Adams announces he will run as independent in New York mayoral race

description: Global markets fall after Trump’s tariff. CDC’s IVF team is fired. College student says rumor amplified by ESPN's Pat McAfee ruined her life.
title: Trump unveils new tariffs and CDC's IVF team is eliminated: Morning Rundown

description: A new death in connection with January’s wildfires has been confirmed, raising the death toll to 30, the County of Los Angeles Department of Medical Examiner’s office said on Wednesday.
title: Death toll in LA's wildfires rises to 30 with new fatality confirmed in Altadena

description: Rob Novak, a Duke basketball fan from Chicago, was in town on a family vacation last Thursday when his beloved Blue Devils squared off against Arizona in the Sweet 16.
title: The planetarium company that wants to change how we watch sports

description: The White House tradition of rolling Easter eggs across the South Lawn is expected to proceed this year despite concern over egg prices and strain on supply.
title: White House plans to use real eggs for the Easter Egg Roll, despite a strain on supply and concern over prices

description: A police officer in upstate New York will not face criminal charges in the fatal shooting of a 13-year-old boy who pointed what turned out to be a BB gun, state Attorney General Letitia James announced Wednesday.
title: Upstate New York officer won’t face criminal charges after fatally shooting a 13-year-old in June

description: For nine months, Hailey Okula’s Instagram followers watched her balance the demands of her job with the happiness of preparing for her and her husband’s first child.
title: Nursing influencer Hailey Okula dies during childbirth after facing infertility struggles

description: According to a filing with D.C. Superior Court, prosecutors dropped the lone charge against James McIntyre, a foster care advocate. No explanation was given.
title: Prosecutors drop charge against man who Rep. Nancy Mace accused of assaulting her at the Capitol

description: The wife of recently-retired Green Beret Clinton Bonnell, who vanished in January, is accused of killing and dismembering him after he told her he wanted a divorce, authorities in North Carolina said.
title: Ex-Green Beret's wife accused of killing and dismembering him after he revealed divorce plans

description: Carey Stewart Cezar, a retired nurse who lives in Baltimore, watched with dismay Wednesday as President Donald Trump announced sweeping tariffs on imports.
title: Her great-grandfather was behind the Smoot-Hawley Tariff Act. She thinks Trump’s tariffs are 'terrible.'
